text: Francis 'Frank' Rule (1896-1982) was an Australian rugby league player who played in the 1920s. ==Playing career== Rule was a champion with North Sydney and won two premierships with them in 1921 and 1922. Rule played seven seasons with Norths between 1920-1927. He also represented New South Wales on six occasions between 1923-1925. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League players. 1995 () Rule died on 6 April 1982, aged 86.
